title.native: バミューダトライアングル ～カラフル・パストラーレ～

description:
The glittering spotlights. The sparkling, fluffy, cute outfits. The charming voices while dancing with bright smiles. Under the dazzling lights on the big city stage, these would be the mermaid idols who swim and dance freely underwater.

But far from this big city, the girls once lived in the peaceful village of Parrel. These girls, who would not even imagine such a glittering future for themselves, are instead just raising a fuss over the snack cakes they are eating. This is the story of the cheerful daily life of mermaids who strive their hardest everyday.

(Source: Official website)
synonyms: カラフル・パストラーレ 〜from Bermuda△〜

tags.name: Mermaid
tags.description: A mythological creature with the body of a human and the tail of a fish.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Swimming
tags.description: Centers around the sport of swimming.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

title.native: カードファイト!! ヴァンガード (2018)
バミューダ△トライアングル カレン オン ステージ♪

node.description: Junji Nishimura is a male Japanese director, an episode director and storyboarder from Yobuko, Saga, Japan, though he currently resides in Karatsu, Saga. After graduating from Meiji Gakuin University in 1980, Nishimura entered into the anime studio Nishiko Production. Nishimura had his first job as an episode director for Baldios in 1980, and went on to be an episode director in other series such as Six God Combination Godmars, and Magical Princess Minky Momo in 1982. In 1984, he resigned from Nishiko and in 1985 had his director debut with Pro Golfer Saru. Since then, he has worked as the director on many anime produced by Studio Deen and later on for Seven Arcs.
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

A musical group part of the BanG Dream! franchise, consisting of 5 voice actors: [Ami Maeshima](https://anilist.co/staff/128161/Ami-Maeshima) as Aya Maruyama on lead vocals, [Sumire Uesaka](https://anilist.co/staff/109441/Sumire-Uesaka) as Chisato Shirasagi, [Sawako Hata](https://anilist.co/staff/111225/Sawako-Hata) as Eve Wakamiya, [Ari Ozawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118663/Ari-Ozawa) as Hina Hikawa, and [Ikumi Nakagami](https://anilist.co/staff/112009/Ikumi-Nakagami) as Maya Yamato.

Their first single, "Shuwarin☆Drea~min", was released on July 12, 2017.
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

In 1984, he resigned from Nishiko and in 1985 had his director debut with Pro Golfer Saru. Since then, he has worked as the director on many anime produced by Studio Deen and later on for Seven Arcs.

After graduating from Meiji Gakuin University in 1980, Nishimura entered into the anime studio Nishiko Production. Nishimura had his first job as an episode director for Baldios in 1980, and went on to be an episode director in other series such as Six God Combination Godmars, and Magical Princess Minky Momo in 1982. In 1984, he resigned from Nishiko and in 1985 had his director debut with Pro Golfer Saru. Since then, he has worked as the director on many anime produced by Studio Deen and later on for Seven Arcs.
Started off as a production manager at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/増田敏彦)

Affiliated with [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/).
